website_summaries.verdict: A small, portable unit that can connect to computer via USB and is very sensitive.
pros: usually does not need recalibration for years
Can interface with a computer to record data

customer_reviews.title: Great support
customer_reviews.text: My boyfriend went though radioactive iodine treatment and we were concerned about measuring how radioactive he was and if the hospital guidelines were sufficient . We order radek one and downloaded the software on a Saturday and called the company for assistance and they called back right away. They explained how to use the equipment and read the data and it turned out my boyfriend was reading higher levels than the hospital prepared us for so we adjusted our routine and kept our distance . I feel like we'd be running blind without it and it's great to know what the Exact readings in our home are . Excellent support / great device .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is great for hobbyist
customer_reviews.text: Works well and is about 75% as sensitive as my $600 personal dosimeter at 1/4 the size, 1/6 the weight and $500 cheaper. This is great for hobbyist. W/downloadable software, one can record readings once every 2 seconds. Speaker is weak, one can feel the vibrator if it's in your hand. It can be put in search mode.
customer_reviews.author: PatricksPC

customer_reviews.title: Convenient way to satisfy my curiosity.
customer_reviews.text: Very handy size, good price, and quick feedback from their representative. My only quibbles are likely part of the trade-off for getting a small, relatively inexpensive dosimeter. My quibbles? The menu requires the instructions to navigate (at least at first). The display updates once every 10 seconds; I'd like it to be more often. Software for the Mac would be nice. But it does the basic job and the price can't be beat (at least not by anything I could find that still looked trustworthy).
customer_reviews.author: John W. Scott

customer_reviews.title: Monitor exposure from body scanner
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to monitor radiation exposure at work due to a new pass through body scanner that was installed next to my desk. I have been told there is no risk of prolonged exposure but would like to monitor this for myself. Will follow up after using for a while. Any idea when iOS will be ready for downloading
customer_reviews.author: colin

customer_reviews.title: I exercised extra precautions with my baby and husband once I came home because just like I suspected
customer_reviews.text: I had to undergo radioactive iodine treatment for thyroid cancer. I was told by the doctors that I could be with my 1 year old son after 2 weeks. I was skeptical about how safe it was. This is why I purchased the Radex One. It worked perfectly and told me exactly what I needed to know. I exercised extra precautions with my baby and husband once I came home because just like I suspected, my radiation levels were still high.
customer_reviews.author: valeria estrella

customer_reviews.title: This unit is small and appears to work well.
customer_reviews.text: The 10 second sample rate is fine for my usage. I cannot comment on battery life as I have not used it for long enough to speculate. As far as accuracy, I have a sample of uranium ore that I keep to use to test these kinds of instruments and it is within its design parameters in what it reads for my sample. It isnt a 'rough duty' device, but the quality appears OK for indoor lab use. How long it lasts is going to determine if its a good value.
customer_reviews.author: S. Stiegel

customer_reviews.title: Delicate and doesn't clip securely
customer_reviews.text: Clip doesn't hold device to pocket or lead vest securely. Bent over while doing a fluoroscopy study and it fell hard to the floor, twice. It now rattles and doesn't respond to any exposure to radiation. I'd be happy to just replace the GM tube which I'm sure is what broke. But I haven't found a source for the part yet. Worked great prior to drops.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Dalie

customer_reviews.title: Broke
customer_reviews.text: Button broken after we change battery few times and turn on and off few times, the button stuck in and never turn on. Device was laying on the shelf and we barely used it. Accuracy seems good but apparently very fragile construction, and not cheap because it lasted little longer then a year. I would like to have another one, but for over a hundred and if it will last only a year and brake like previous one...I am not sure.
customer_reviews.author: Elena Lemmon

customer_reviews.title: Real Deal Very Happy
customer_reviews.text: Real deal. Simple to use detects beta, gamma, and x-rays. I tested this device on several sources and it's remarkably accurate. It's small enough to use without drawing attention. You can spend a lot more money, but for most people this product is great. Seller was fast to respond, shipping was accurate and fast. I'm very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Derek Chastain

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service
customer_reviews.text: The thing all of a sudden stopped being reliable or sensitive. It now takes a lot of radiation to get a response. 4 months is not a long life. UPDATE: Mr. Dimitri will not agree to a replacement, even though analysis showed a variation of .5uSv for the same source. Not for sensitive work, and my one star stands. SECOND UPDATE: Geiger counter has been replaced and works well. Upgrading to a 5 star
customer_reviews.author: swp

customer_reviews.title: Nice little detector
customer_reviews.text: Good detector. The only thing I would like to see (perhaps with a future version) is the ability to set the alarm level higher than 1.0; I'd like to set that level at around 4.5 to 5.
customer_reviews.author: GigasWerden

customer_reviews.title: tried it for real
customer_reviews.text: got injected with a radioactive isotope yesterday as part of a medical scan...when i got home and tried it, it went nuts into alarm and they i could watch the levels go down as time went on, until zero this am. very cool.
customer_reviews.author: L. G,

customer_reviews.title: Great portable device
customer_reviews.text: Family members want to take this to work and various oft visited locations to check on levels. Very happy with the portability and measurements.
customer_reviews.author: CheckAmazonFirst

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tool for measuring background radiation. Easy to pack for travel.
customer_reviews.text: An excellent tool for measuring background radiation. I travel with this little Geiger counter frequently and enjoy discovering the different amounts of background radiation wherever I travel. I have several Geiger counters, but this is the simplest to use--AND the only one I own that is simplest to pack. Highly recommended and the company is very professional.
customer_reviews.author: William O.. Robertson

customer_reviews.title: Great Counter
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little counter. I've run it since the day it arrived (2.5 months) on the same battery and it's going strong. The display is small but clear. As others have said, the plastic window is stuck in place with tape, mine fell off and I pushed it back in place. If I were carrying this around a work environment, I'd want to tape it in place so it didn't get lost so 1 star docked.
customer_reviews.author: TedM

customer_reviews.title: ... my second Geiger Counter and this little gadget is Awesome! It will run a long time on its ...
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Geiger Counter and this little gadget is Awesome! It will run a long time on its batteries so you can wear it on your neck and use it as a personal dosimeter; it is that small! It agrees with my other Geiger Counter to within about .1 micro Seiverts, but, this device does not report the variance of the measurement.
customer_reviews.author: Don Webster

customer_reviews.title: Very useful device if you work in hospital or dental office,...
customer_reviews.text: Measures accumulated dose as well as spikes. USB port and software allows to see a graph and other useful info more clearly
customer_reviews.author: ALLERGY &.

customer_reviews.title: An easy to use personal Geiger counter.
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with this purchase. I used it to make certain the imported item I wanted to purchase wasn’t radioactive from Fukushima. Easy to read and carry.
customer_reviews.author: Konaman

customer_reviews.title: I know what it say's but what is it telling me?
customer_reviews.text: the only objections are that the instructions don't give a very clear description of what the readings are actually telling you and it would be a big help if it had a lighted display for reading it at night. It is actually easy to use and read and light weight to carry
customer_reviews.author: GREGORY SANTANGELO

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great device... very light and portable, easy to use and functions well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dont waste your money!
customer_reviews.text: I went to an old nuclear Plant site yesterday and was eagerly wanting to see what the Dosimeter found and all it did was error out. I never did show one reading at all. I kept turning it off and back on thinking it would reset itself and nothing! Where do I send this hunk of junk back to? Very displeased!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It was a good experiencie buy the device
customer_reviews.text: It was a good experiencie buy the device. I am a doctor, and I need to measure radiation of a portable rx camera. I hope to buy a other device for someone else. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: What's not to like about this device. It arrives well packaged, has clear instructions, and is easy to use with a very long battery life. I am happy that I purchased & am now considering other devices from Quanta.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Lethbridge

customer_reviews.title: radiation detector
customer_reviews.text: Cant get the software to link to my detector....doesnt even see it! I may return it and find anouther one!
customer_reviews.author: pcc

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: It works ok. Gives real time information. Conformed fairly well with GM readings. Works in areas where there may be radon, and around radioactive rocks and minerals.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: I have no clue if it works, but it’s great fun and an easy way to entertain paranoid neighbors.
customer_reviews.author: Reid Turnbull

customer_reviews.title: don't buy
customer_reviews.text: The first one arrived broken. The replacement died after a few days.
customer_reviews.author: Quantus

customer_reviews.title: Great gadget but display too small
customer_reviews.text: Display too small and requires good illumination. So, I have to use flashlight in daytime to see where the decimal point falls. The start-up time is a little long, as well as refresh time. The pocket clip is useless and falls off. Otherwise the counter works quite well and matches the readout of expensive professional counters. Has a surprisingly long battery life for a real Geiger-Muller counter.
customer_reviews.author: Pete Zaitcev

customer_reviews.title: Great device, the clip sucks, though
customer_reviews.text: If you are going to use this, the clip WILL separate from the device. make sure you tie on some thread to the hole on the device to prevent losing the device.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher S.

customer_reviews.title: Feedback
customer_reviews.text: The parchase was both performance as price driven. It is a first-time purchase, we do not know the product but the manufacturer has a good reputation.
customer_reviews.author: EBCO SYSTEMS

customer_reviews.title: Did not hold up with out requiring major repairs. ...
customer_reviews.text: Did not hold up with out requiring major repairs. it dose its job. Warned me when I was entering a high rad area. The solder joints for the retention wires on the tube broke. One was not even done correctly form the manufacture.
customer_reviews.author: Omar Nagia

customer_reviews.title: Stops working after 4 months
customer_reviews.text: I really liked my RADEX, unfortunately the unit just stopped working after 4 months. The display continuously shows "Err", regardless of new/old batterry being inserted, even after reset of the device and cleanup of all data.
customer_reviews.author: Tomas B.

customer_reviews.title: Avoid hot areas
customer_reviews.text: I love this product, it helps me to avoid hot areas woth the alarm. I repair nuclear medicine machines.
customer_reviews.author: Eder

customer_reviews.title: Small size for what it does, very long battery ...
customer_reviews.text: Small size for what it does, very long battery life, the plastic panel for the buttons are flimsy. Wish it would work on Linux.
customer_reviews.author: why does it matter what my name is

customer_reviews.title: At first I was reasonably satisfied with this unit
customer_reviews.text: Purchased my unit less than 9 months ago. At first I was reasonably satisfied with this unit; tested it for a month then removed the battery and stored it safely in my bug-out-bag. I just put a fresh battery in it to check some gemstones that I was planning to give away for the holidays and the unit doesn't power on. Contacts are good, everything seems to be in order on the inside, it's just dead. I'm just glad I checked it before needing to use it for something very serious; as they say... two is one and one is none.
customer_reviews.author: G. Riggs

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for a school science fair project. Easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: skyranger

customer_reviews.title: Small unit no logging for me
customer_reviews.text: This is an easy to carry unit that seems to be more or less on par with with my other Geiger counter, but it arrived with a dead USB connector. ( I tried several USB cables and 2 other computers)It's DEAD. The main reason I purchased this was for the logging capabilities along with it's small size. And if there had been some manufacture's support. Would have liked to give it 5 stars
customer_reviews.author: Equate Null

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Fits nicely in my pocket next to my smart phone.
customer_reviews.author: GlennPowers

customer_reviews.title: Worked, for a week or so.
customer_reviews.text: I'm giving this item 2 stars because it did work, fairly well, for about a week. After the 7th or 8th day, I started getting unbelievable readings from the dosimeter that would probably only be seen if I were bathing in a tub of liquid uranium. Trying to figure out what was happening, I downloaded the Radex control center to my laptop and connected the dosimeter with a USB cable. Fine. Until I unplugged - and the unit died. I replaced the battery seviral times, reset the device, everything I could think of, but now all it does is beep incessantly with a blank screen. So, reliability is a no-go. Still looking for a decent EDC dosimeter.
customer_reviews.author: Discworldfan

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Print Instructions are too small and hard to read. And hard to read the meter as well
customer_reviews.author: Robert Seidman

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Love it!! Amazing for an 8 inch thick mattress. Funny was looking at a mattress topper and realized it was nearly the cost of my mattress! Decided I don’t need one and got s mattress cover instead.
customer_reviews.author: DM

customer_reviews.title: Seems pretty accurate compared to other meters I use
customer_reviews.text: Seems pretty accurate compared to other meters I use. Made of cheap plastic and don't think will last more than 1 year of every day carry, unfortunately.
customer_reviews.author: Ty Pigeon

product_meta.title: RADEX ONE Personal RAD Safety, High Sensitivity Compact Personal Dosimeter, Geiger Counter, Radiation Detector w/Software (U.S. Version)
product_meta.description:
RADEX ONE - geiger counter and radiation dosimeter (radioactivity indicator) is designed to measure ambient ionized radiation types Beta, Gamma and X-ray, radioactivity of materials and products, as well as the accumulated radiation dose received. 

Features: 

- Beta, Gamma and X-ray detection 

- Very fast: immediate result in 10 seconds, best result in 30 secs. 

- Compact and portable design 

- Same sensitivity and accuracy as a full-size geiger counter 

- UNIQUE: Accumulated (not just immediate) dose 

- PC connection via USB cord (provided). 

- Software download from www.quartarad.com / Support / RD ONE and MR107: 
https://quartarad.com/radex-one-data-center/

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
